metadata.title: Portuguese Grammar Placement Test - B Levels

questions.pt: Quando era criança, eu morava em Lisboa
questions.question: Why is 'morava' (imperfect) used instead of 'morei' (preterite)?
questions.correct: Describes an ongoing situation in the past (where I lived during childhood)
options: Describes an ongoing situation in the past (where I lived during childhood)
Morei would also be correct here
Morava is more formal than morei

questions.pt: Ontem eu comi pizza. Quando era jovem, eu comia pizza toda semana.
questions.question: What is the difference?
questions.correct: Comi = single completed action; Comia = habitual/repeated action in the past
options: Comi = single completed action; Comia = habitual/repeated action in the past
They could be swapped with no change in meaning
Comi is formal; Comia is informal
Comi is for recent past; Comia is for distant past
Comia is conditional; Comi is indicative
Comi is singular; Comia is continuous

questions.en: While I was studying, the phone rang
questions.question: Complete the sentence:

questions.en: I used to come here always

questions.pt: João é mais alto que Maria
questions.question: What type of comparison is this?

questions.en: This book is less interesting than that one
questions.question: Complete the sentence:

questions.en: She is as tall as her brother
questions.question: Complete the sentence:

questions.pt: Ele é o mais alto da turma
questions.question: What makes this a superlative?
questions.correct: The definite article 'o' before 'mais' indicates superlative
options: The definite article 'o' before 'mais' indicates superlative
The word 'mais' alone makes it superlative
The phrase 'da turma' makes it superlative
Superlative and comparative are the same in Portuguese
The adjective 'alto' is in superlative form

questions.en: She is the smartest in the class
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
What does this mean?
options: Today is more bad than yesterday

questions.pt: Este livro é melhor que aquele
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: This book is better than that one
options: This book is better than that one
This book is more good than that one
This book was better than that one

questions.pt: São Paulo é maior que Brasília
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: São Paulo is bigger than Brasília
options: São Paulo is bigger than Brasília
São Paulo is bigger than Lisbon
São Paulo is more grande than Brasília
São Paulo was bigger than Brasília

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: This movie is the most interesting

questions.question: Why is 'São' (plural) used here?
options: São is always used for time

questions.question: Why is 'É' (singular) used instead of 'São' (plural)?
questions.correct: Meio-dia is treated as singular (one moment in time)
options: Meio-dia is treated as singular (one moment in time)
São would also be correct here
É is always used for time
Meio-dia is an exception with no rule
É is used because it's before noon

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: I will tell him the truth

questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: I am going to see him tomorrow
options: I am going to see him tomorrow
You are going to see him tomorrow
I go to see him tomorrow
He is going to see me tomorrow

questions.pt: É importante para nós falarmos português
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: It is important for us to speak Portuguese
options: It is important for us to speak Portuguese
It is important that we speak Portuguese
It is important to speak Portuguese
It was important for us to speak Portuguese

questions.pt: O livro que eu li é muito bom
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: The book that I read is very good
options: The book that I read is very good
The book which I am reading is very good
The good book that I read
I read a very good book
The book I will read is very good
The book is very good to read

questions.pt: A cidade onde nasci é pequena
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: The city where I was born is small
options: The city where I was born is small
The city that I was born is small
The small city where I was born
I was born in a small city
The city where I live is small
Where I was born the city is small

questions.question: Complete the sentence:
What does this mean?
questions.correct: The person about whom I spoke
options: The person about whom I spoke
The person that I spoke to
The person I will speak about

questions.pt: O que você disse é verdade
questions.question: What does this mean?
options: That which you said is true
The thing you said is true

questions.question: Complete the sentence:
questions.template: Ela é mais alta __ o irmão

questions.en: Please speak slowly (formal, to one person)
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
What is the difference between these two commands?
questions.correct: Venha is formal (você), Vem is informal (tu)
options: Venha is formal (você), Vem is informal (tu)
Venha is plural, Vem is singular
Venha is a request, Vem is an order
Vem is formal, Venha is informal
Venha is past tense, Vem is present

questions.en: Please open the windows (to multiple people)
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
What does this mean?
questions.correct: I went back to studying Portuguese
options: I went back to studying Portuguese
I came back to study Portuguese

questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: I kept waiting for an hour
options: I kept waiting for an hour
I stayed waiting for an hour
I was waiting for an hour
I will wait for an hour
I am waiting for an hour

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: I am starting to work here
I work here from the start

questions.en: I'm going to pick up the kids
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
What does this mean?
options: They will tell me the truth
They are telling me the truth
They said the truth to me

questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: I asked him/her for a favor
options: I asked him/her for a favor
I ask him/her for a favor
He asked me for a favor
I will ask for a favor
I am asking for a favor
I requested a favor from him

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: He will give me the book
He is giving me the book
He gave the book to me

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: She will ask me to help
She is asking me to help

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: He said for me to wait
He will tell me to wait
He is telling me to wait

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: I used to go to Brazil

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: I used to be a teacher
I seem to be a teacher

questions.pt: O homem cujo filho é médico
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: The man whose son is a doctor
options: The man whose son is a doctor
The man who is a doctor
The man that has a son doctor
The son whose father is a doctor
The doctor whose father is a man
The man with a doctor son

questions.pt: A casa em que moro é grande
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: The house in which I live is big
options: The house in which I live is big
The house where I live is big
The big house I live in
I live in a big house
The house that I live is big
In the house I live it is big

options: She said she would be tired

options: He said he wants to come

questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: I was going to travel but I cancelled
options: I was going to travel but I cancelled
I will travel but I cancelled
I went to travel but I cancelled
I am going to travel but I will cancel
I wanted to travel but I cancelled
I used to travel but I cancelled

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: The book will be written in 1900
The book went to be written in 1900

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: Portuguese will be spoken in Brazil
Portuguese is being spoken in Brazil

questions.en: The store is closed on Sundays
questions.question: Complete the sentence:

questions.pt: Todo dia eu estudo vs O dia todo eu estudo
questions.question: What is the difference?
questions.correct: Todo dia = every day; O dia todo = all day long
options: Todo dia = every day; O dia todo = all day long
They mean exactly the same thing
Todo dia = all day; O dia todo = every day
Todo dia is formal; O dia todo is informal
Todo dia is past; O dia todo is present

questions.question: What does this mean?
options: I hope you will be strong
I want you to be strong

questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: If I knew, I would say
options: If I knew, I would say
If I know, I will say
If I knew, I will say

questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: If I were rich, I would travel
options: If I were rich, I would travel
If I was rich, I traveled
If I am rich, I will travel
If I were rich, I travel
When I was rich, I traveled
If I were rich, I will travel

questions.pt: Quando eu tiver tempo, vou viajar
questions.question: What does this mean?
questions.correct: When I have time, I will travel
options: When I have time, I will travel
If I have time, I will travel
When I had time, I traveled
When I have time, I travel
If I had time, I would travel
When I will have time, I will travel

questions.question: What does 'enfim' signal here?
questions.correct: Reaching a conclusion after a process (finally/in the end)
options: Reaching a conclusion after a process (finally/in the end)

questions.en: I thought it was expensive. Actually, it was cheap.
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
questions.template: Eu achava que era caro. __, era barato.

questions.en: He's a doctor. In other words, he studied medicine.
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
questions.template: Ele é médico. __, ele estudou medicina.

questions.en: She speaks English. By the way, she also speaks French.
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
questions.template: Ela fala inglês. __, ela também fala francês.

questions.en: He didn't study. That's why he failed.
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
Complete the sentence:
questions.template: Ele é inteligente. __, ele é trabalhador.

questions.pt: O filme foi longo. Contudo, foi interessante.
questions.question: Which marker expresses the SAME relationship as 'contudo'?

questions.pt: Ele estuda muito. Portanto, passa nos exames.
questions.question: What relationship does 'portanto' express?
What does this mean?
questions.correct: I have been studying a lot lately
options: I have been studying a lot lately
I walk while studying a lot
